title: 107_hr1968
content: The Act titled "National Health Service Corps Reinvestment Act of 2001" revises and extends the program for the National Health Service Corps. It includes provisions for the general program. The National Health Service Corps Reinvestment Act of 2001 amends the Public Health Service Act to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2002 through 2006 and designates certain facilities as health professional shortage areas. The National Health Service Corps Reinvestment Act of 2001 designates Federally-qualified health centers and rural health clinics as specified facilities under the Public Health Service Act, while also removing provisions regarding cost sharing. SEC. 102. SCHOLARSHIP AND LOAN REPAYMENT PROGRAMS. Section 338H(b)(1) of the Public Health Service Act is amended to authorize appropriations of $131,886,000 for fiscal year 2002 and necessary sums for fiscal years 2003 through 2006. Additionally, a demonstration program allows individuals to fulfill obligated service part-time under certain conditions. The Secretary may provide a waiver for part-time service under certain conditions, including a request from an approved entity, appropriateness for the health professional shortage area, agreement from the Corps member, and written agreement between the entity and the Corps member. The entity and the Corps member agree in writing that part-time service will be at least 20 hours per week. The Corps member agrees to extend the period of obligated service if providing part-time service, and to apply damages if failing to complete the obligated service. The agreement states that 338E will be applied by using the full-time equivalent of the part-time service provided by the Corp member. Title II excludes certain scholarships and loan payments under the National Health Service Corps program from gross income. Title II amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude amounts received as a qualified scholarship under the National Health Service Corps Scholarship Program from gross income. This amendment applies to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2001. Additionally, loan payments under the National Health Service Corps Loan Repayment Program are also excluded from gross income. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to exclude loan payments under the National Health Service Corps Loan Repayment Program from gross income. This amendment applies to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2001. Additionally, a conforming amendment regarding reimbursement of tax liability for loan payments is made to the Public Health Service Act. The Act and its amendments take effect on October 1, 2001, or upon enactment, whichever is later.
